summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, providing the password for a drive containing discovery materials related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the signatory of the letter, acting as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, providing access to discovery materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which the discovery materials are being provided.

connections.description: Strauss, as the U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Password Transmission
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office transmits the password for a drive containing discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case to the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It provides the password for a drive containing discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell, who is identified by her inmate number (02879-509).
The letter is signed by Audrey Strauss in her capacity as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.
The correspondence is directed to the legal department of the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, where Maxwell was likely held.
